TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by PERSON , ORG at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
In DATE the police arrested PERSON and PERSON on suspicion of having robbed PERSON . They testified that the applicant had been an accomplice to that robbery .

On DATE the applicant was arrested . According to the applicant , the arresting officers did not explain what the reasons for his arrest were and did not inform him about the statutory rights of an accused . During the first few interviews the applicant refused to answer investigator ’s questions relying on his right not to incriminate himself .
On DATE the ORG prosecutor ’s office authorised the applicant ’s detention on remand . The detention order indicated that he was accused of having been an accomplice to a robbery .

The case was referred for trial to ORG . The trial court , composed of PERSON , the presiding judge , PERSON and PERSON , lay assessors , examined documentary evidence , statements by several witnesses and by the applicant ’s co - defendants . On DATE the ORG found the applicant guilty as charged and sentenced him to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment .

The local television company recorded the pronouncement of the judgment of DATE and made a programme about the criminal proceedings against the applicant . On DATE the programme was shown on television . A reporter allegedly made defamatory comments concerning the applicant .

On DATE the applicant filed an appeal against the judgment of DATE . He challenged , inter alia , the composition of the bench that had given the said judgment . Whilst the Federal Law on ORG of ORG allowed lay assessors to be called once DATE for a maximum period of DATE , or for as long as a specific case lasted , the assessors PERSON and PERSON had been engaged earlier in the course of DATE and DATE in CARDINAL other trials .
On DATE ORG of GPE dismissed the appeal and upheld the applicant ’s conviction . ORG noted that “ the complaints of the co - defendants about unlawful composition of the bench were unfounded ” .

On DATE a deputy Prosecutor General of GPE lodged an application before the Presidium of ORG of GPE , seeking revision of the judgments of DATE and CARDINAL DATE , by way of a supervisory review . The deputy ORG argued that the trial court which had heard the applicant ’s case had been composed in violation of LAW on ORG because the lay assessors , PERSON and PERSON , had participated in CARDINAL criminal cases in DATE .

On DATE the Presidium of ORG of GPE accepted the application for a supervisory review , quashed the judgments of DATE and CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case for a fresh examination . In particular , the ORG held as follows :
“ According to paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL of LAW ... ‘ lay assessors are called once DATE to perform their duties in a regional court for as long as a particular case ORG .
However , that requirement of the law had not been taken into account when the trial court which examined the criminal case against PERSON ... had been set up .
As it appears from the case - file , the judgment of ORG of DATE against Mr ORG was taken by the trial court composed of the presiding judge and CARDINAL lay assessors , PERSON and PERSON .

According to a copy of the judgment of ORG of DATE , ... in DATE the same lay assessors were engaged in the examination of another criminal case against Mr GPE and PERSON , which was pending DATE and DATE .

Therefore the lay assessors , PERSON and PERSON , were engaged in examination of the criminal case against PERSON ... in violation of the abovementioned law , and under LAW that fact serves as a ground for quashing of the judgment because it was issued by the unlawfully composed court . ”
The ORG also held that the applicant should remain in custody pending the new examination of his case .

On DATE ORG of GPE , composed of CARDINAL professional judge , re - examined the applicant ’s case , found him guilty of aggravated extortion and robbery and sentenced him to DATE , DATE and CARDINAL days’ imprisonment . ORG based its judgment on statements by the victims and witnesses , confessions by the applicant ’s co - defendants given in open court and documentary evidence . The judgment of CARDINAL DATE was not appealed against and became final on DATE .
The applicant was released on DATE because he had served his sentence .

For the summary of relevant domestic law provisions concerning appointment of lay assessors see PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , ORG CARDINALIV , § CARDINAL , and PERSON v. GPE ( dec . ) , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE .
